alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:14AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Calhoun, eastern Ritchie and southern Doddridge Counties through 1045 AM EST... At 1014 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Grantsville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisville, Pennsboro, Pullman, Auburn, Greenwood, Smithville, Berea, Grove and Burnt House. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 41 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
